channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [TIKA-3267] Method getEnableImageProcessing() in TesseractOCRConfig should be renamed
item.description: Method getEnableImageProcessing() in TesseractOCRConfig should be renamed to isEnableImageProcessing() to follow Java convention of using 'is' in the case of a bookean
item.summary: Method getEnableImageProcessing() in TesseractOCRConfig should be renamed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: I have a feeling this may be due to the magic reflection-based stuff for whitelisted property setting via HTTP headers in the server. So, would need to check and possibly update that too at the same time
I actually think it happened because the field used to be an int (0 or 1) and was changed to boolean, but the method name was not renamed.
There are numerous cases of this throughout the codebase, esp in config objects.  We can do a bulk change for 2.0.0.

UNSTABLE: Integrated in Jenkins build Tika » tika-main-jdk8 #120 (See https://ci-builds.apache.org/job/Tika/job/tika-main-jdk8/120/)
TIKA-3267 change boolean getXYZ to boolean isXYZ (tallison: https://github.com/apache/tika/commit/5ad435d39e39558b98af3af5aca291eef22651f0)
